wordpressPost.content:
A NEW WAY TO AGE

Renewing yourself is your body’s master plan for rejuvenation.  This consists of three important steps; protect, repair and rejuvenate.  Our body’s renewal system prevents disease by protecting the cells and then repairing the damaged ones.  We are given a specific healing system and its mission is to achieve maximum health.

Why do we need an elaborate healing system to renew ourselves?  Because the damage that we do to ourselves and for what our environment does to us, threatens our entire existence.

Renewal is a constant process in our body.  Just trying to repair the everyday wear and tear is bad enough but then, the renewal process must kick it up a notch should we get sick or injured.   When we have an acute or chronic condition, our body kicks into overdrive to repair the damage that has been done.

A good example of how the body can renew itself better is, if you break a bone, or cut yourself or, sustain an injury of some kind.  If you don’t have your renewal system revved up then it may take you a bit of time to heal.

However, if your cells are in renewal mode then you will heal much faster.     In order to extend our life span, we must halt cellular damage and increase our healing system.  To do this we come back to, protecting, repairing and regenerating our cells.  Each one of these should function to its optimal level and if they don’t then, the entire system will fail.

We already know the key to cell renewal is antioxidants because our cells are under constant attack from free radicals.  The damage free radicals do to cells shortens our life which means that we die before we need to due to cellular damage.

“A typical cell is hit by approximately twenty billion free radicals per day.”   So long as we have enough free radicals in our body, we can fight this.  Think about it, twenty billion free radicals hit just one cell! And, we have so many cells.

When you get down to it, why wouldn’t we help our body fight against this mass attack by consuming antioxidants and avoiding the things that cause free radicals in the first place?  See when we let our antioxidants fall below optimal then free radicals have the upper hand.  After a billion hits here and there, now you have serious cellular damage.

This type of damage not only causes disease but it’s the quickest way to aging.  Again, how to counter this is to take in generous amounts of antioxidant foods and supplements.
